output_list.reason: In the transfer function, the addition operation for balances[_to] can result in an integer overflow if the sum of balances[_to] and _value is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in a uint256 variable.

In the transferFrom function, the addition operation for balances[_to] can result in an integer overflow if the sum of balances[_to] and _value is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in a uint256 variable.

In the approve function, the assignment operation for allowed[msg.sender][_spender] can result in an integer overflow if _value is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in a uint256 variable.

In the approveProxy function, the assignment operation for allowed[_from][_spender] can result in an integer overflow if _value is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in a uint256 variable.

In the allocateTokens function, the addition operation for totalSupply and balances[to] can result in an integer overflow if the sum of totalSupply and value is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in a uint256 variable.
